👉As of 1998, 2.78 million men in the U.S. had been victims of attempted or completed rape.
👉About 3% of American men—or 1 in 33—have experienced an attempted or completed rape in their lifetime.
👉1 out of every 10 rape victims are male.

6% Gun
4% Knife
1% Other
👉Personal weapons—such as hands, feet or teeth—are used against victims of sexual violence in about 2 out of 3 cases.
👉90% of rapes and sexual assaults are perpetrated by one offender. 10% are perpetrated by two or more.
🚨For fucks sakes educate yourselves on the topic at hand before you offer an opinion. You moronic mouth-breathers are exactly the reason why rape survivors don’t come forward.

@penor_pie I hope that you gained some knowledge or grasped some understanding of what rape culture is. And after knowing this, if you still think rape culture is a myth, you have GOTTA rethink your life. I provided proper statistics with a VALID SOURCE that you can refer to. Unless you give me the same, your arguments will remain moot. (Oooh I forgot to menion less than half of thevictims (I think 23%) ACTUALLY REPORT their rape. And only 4.6% actually lead to arrests. 0.5% lead to felony conviction. And ONLY 0.46 are actually incarcerated. Yea so not everyone is you 'suffering because of feminism', as you put it). CHECK RAINN for source. Not making this up.

@penor_pie Lastly: Rape culture is not attacking men or women. It is attacking the societal norms, and what kind of shit has been normalized and romanticized, that encourages rape culture. Like teaching your kids that when a guy/girl is being mean to you, that means that they like you. Or that 'if you really love her, don't let her go, even if she says no'. Like kids are taught that shit. How fucked up is that?

@blueunicornsburp 4. Usually sexual assaulters get about 15-20 years in jail. Even child sexual abusers don't get life imprisonment. (oooh another interesting fact- every 9 minutes, a child in the United States gets sexually abused. Yes a CHILD. I think 12-17 year olds fall under one of the majority of the victims of sexual abuse. Just a little something to think about).

@penor_pie 3. Rape culture is not about 'just men' or 'just women'. It is about BOTH OF THEM. It is about society and it's norms. Much like feminism which literally means standing for gender equality. It is the literal opposite of sexism.

@penor_pie 2. Less than 15% of the reported cases are false (in the U.S. I don't have the exact statistics for the whole world, sadly). Oooh another example of rape culture is inflating false-reports statistics. 
Also I think 1 in 5 American women, and 1 in 73 (?) American men are RAPED.  1 in 2 American women, and 1 in 5 American men, have experienced some kind of sexual abuse at some point in their lives. On average, every 98 seconds an American is sexually abused. So if you think this is a 'small percentage', you need to re-think your life. (I am not making these numbers up. I got this from RAINN, who get most of their statistical reports from US Office of Justice Department)

@penor_pie Please please please get your statistics right. There is so many things wrong with that. 
1. That is a half-assed definition of rape culture. Rape culture is essentially a culture in which sexual abuse is normalized and victims are blamed. Example: Asking a girl what was she wearing during the incident, and whether she was intoxicated. Or telling a guy that he 'want it', just because he is a guy. Or saying things like 'boys will be boys', and slut-shaming a girl for having sex. Or saying catcalling is 'complimenting'. Or grabbing a man/woman's ass without permission. Overtly sexualizing and objectifying men and women. THAT IS RAPE CULTURE.
